author: BBC News
description:
Today, the new Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood said that the UK could suspend visas for countries with who don’t “play ball” with the government’s migrant return plans.  

This comes after the Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s surprise cabinet reshuffle at the end of last week, triggered by the resignation of his Deputy Angela Rayner, who paid an incorrect amount of stamp duty on a property. The Labour NEC has announced the timeline for a deputy leader election campaign.  

Adam and Chris unpack the Home Secretary’s plans, and ask — who could be the next deputy PM?  Adam also speaks to the new Scotland Secretary Douglas Alexander about his new brief. They discuss the upcoming deputy leadership election and how the reshuffle may impact the direction of the party.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews
title: Another UK government plan to tackle illegal migration | BBC Newscast

author: BBC News
description:
Prince William and Catherine have paid tribute to the late Queen Elizabeth II on the third anniversary of her death, as Prince Harry laid a wreath on his return to the UK.
 
The Prince and Princess of Wales visited a Women's Institute event in Sunningdale, Berkshire, to meet members of an organisation with a long association with the late Queen.
 
On Monday morning, Prince Harry - who has travelled back to the UK for the first time in five months - privately laid a wreath and paid his respects to the late Queen in Windsor, where she is buried.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#Royals #RoyalFamily #BBCNews
title: Prince Harry lays wreath in memory of late Queen | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Six people have been killed and eight others wounded by Palestinian gunmen in one of the deadliest shooting attacks in Jerusalem in the past few years.
 
Israeli police said "two terrorists arrived in a vehicle" and opened fire towards a bus stop at Ramot Junction, on the city's northern outskirts. An off-duty soldier and a civilian returned fire, "neutralising" the attackers, it added.
 
Israeli media identified the dead as five men, aged between 25 and 79, and a 60-year-old woman.
 
There was no immediate claim from any armed groups, although Hamas praised the attack.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#Israel #Jerusalem #BBCNews
title: Jerusalem shooting: Six killed by Palestinian gunmen | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
French Prime Minister François Bayrou has lost the vote of confidence he called in his government.
 
France's National Assembly has voted by 364 votes to 194 to eject him from office and bring down his minority government. Another 25 MPs abstained.
 
Bayrou initiated Monday's surprise vote himself, seeking, as he explained it, to "shock" politicians into agreeing on a way to tackle the country's looming debt crisis - but it's been clear for weeks that he was heading for defeat.
 
He now has to present Emmanuel Macron with the resignation of his government, which according to French media he will do tomorrow morning.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog 
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 
 
#France #BBCNews
title: French government collapses as MPs vote to oust prime minister | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Israeli forces intensified strikes in Gaza City on Sunday, with air strikes also reported on tents, homes and the Al Farabi school.
 
The Israeli military also hit a fourth high-rise building in Gaza City, forcing residents to leave as part of its plans to cease the area.

The Israeli Defence Forces claim the building was being used by Hamas militants but did not provide any evidence.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#Israel #Gaza #BBCNews
title: Israel intensifies strikes on Gaza City | BBC News

title: Blood Moon rising across the world. #Moon #BBCNews #Shorts

author: BBC News
description:
At least 13 people have been killed and dozens injured in Nepal after demonstrations against a government social media ban led to clashes between protesters and security forces.
 
Thousands heeded a call by demonstrators describing themselves as Generation Z to gather near the parliament building in Kathmandu over the decision to ban platforms including Facebook, X and YouTube.
 
Nepal's Minister for Communication Prithvi Subba said police had had to use force - which included water cannons, batons and firing rubber bullets.
 
The government has said social media platforms need to be regulated to tackle fake news, hate speech and online fraud.
 
But popular platforms such as Instagram have millions of users in Nepal, who rely on them for entertainment, news and business.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#Nepal #SocialMedia #BBCNews
title: At least 13 dead in Nepal after protests against social media ban | BBC News

author: BBC News
title: Deadly protests in Nepal against new social media ban. #Nepal #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
Law enforcement agencies across Europe have admitted they are struggling to stop the growing quantity of cocaine crossing the Atlantic from South America.
 
The Maritime Analysis Operations Centre (MAOC), which polices the transatlantic drug trade, said 100 ships suspected of trafficking drugs to Europe were not stopped last year because the authorities didn't have enough vessels to intercept them.
 
Up to 600 vessels are monitored by MAOC each day, while record amounts of cocaine are being produced in South America, said its director, Sjoerd Top.
 
The drug is usually shipped in large container ships to European ports like Rotterdam and Antwerp. But security has been tightened there, so smugglers are looking for alternative routes.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#Europe #Ireland #BBCNews
title: Huge drugs bust reveals battles on cocaine 'superhighway' | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
At least five people have been killed and seven seriously wounded in a shooting attack in Jerusalem, paramedics have said.
 
Israel's Magen David Adom ambulance service identified the dead as three men in their 30s, one woman in her 50s, and one man in his 50s. Twelve people have been injured, it added, including seven in a serious condition with gunshot wounds.
 
Israeli police said two "terrorists" opened fire towards a bus stop at Ramot Junction, on the city's northern outskirts.

There was no immediate claim from any armed groups.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#Jerusalem #Israel #BBCNews
title: Five people killed in Jerusalem shooting attack, officials say | BBC News

title: UK emergency test alarm sounds live on BBC. #UK #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
New Zealand police have found the two missing children of fugitive Tom Phillips who was killed in western Waitako early on Monday.
 
Phillips had been on the run with his three children for almost four years in the wilderness, until he was fatally shot by police officers who were responding to an armed robbery. 
 
One of the children was with Phillips and was unharmed. The child assisted police in locating their siblings as officers conducted a massive hunt in near-freezing temperatures. 
 
The children's mother says she's "saddened" by the events but also "deeply relived" her children's "ordeal has come to an end". 
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog 
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 
 
#NewZealand #BBCNews
title: New Zealand fugitive Tom Phillips shot dead by police and his missing children found  | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Erin Patterson has been sentenced to life in prison with a non-parole period of 33 years.

The Australian was convicted in July for killing three relatives and trying to kill another at a family lunch in 2023, where she served them beef Wellingtons laced with toxic death cap mushrooms.

Patterson's in-laws Don and Gail Patterson and Gail's sister Heather Wilkinson died days after the meal in 2023.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Australia #BBCNews
title: Australian triple murderer Erin Patterson jailed for life over toxic mushroom lunch | BBC News
